H0.text: Protons and neutrons are the particles responsible for the electric charge of an atom.

H1.text: Protons and electrons are the particles responsible for the electric charge of an atom.

H2.text: Neutrons and molecules are the particles responsible for the electric charge of an atom.

H3.text: Molecules and electrons are the particles responsible for the electric charge of an atom.

A4.text: Within the limits of experimental accuracy, the electron charge is identical to the charge of a proton, but with the opposite sign.

A5.text: Electrons have an electric charge of −1.602176634×10−19 C, which is used as a standard unit of charge for subatomic particles, and is also called the elementary charge.
